page.title: 13GRANGE CHINE NR. BRIGHSTONE
page.content: As you cross over the Military Road near Grange Farm there is a gravel path leading towards the sea. If you follow this you sea the chine, small and unexpected from the road. Chines are a common coastal feature on the Isle of Wight. The steep slopes of the chine walls are rugged and have a few small bushes covering them.Wild flowers and nettles also grow here. In the bottom of the chine is a dirty small stream. This is narrow in the chine, then it widens out to form a lagoon before continuing, narrow again, towards the sea. The cloudy stream actually colours the sea at the mouth of the chine.We could even see this from the top of Brighstone Downs nearly 4km away. At the top of the chine there is a camp site on the cliff.
